learningObjectives.text: Apply strategic communication principles to analyze and present donor engagement data for diverse audiences

traceability.employerNeed: A presentation our board can understand and act on
traceability.studentGoal: Learn to translate complex information for different audiences
traceability.institutionalOutcome: Demonstrate professional communication skills in workplace settings

learningObjectives.text: Conduct qualitative and quantitative analysis to identify meaningful patterns in donor behavior

traceability.employerNeed: Clear analysis of donor retention patterns with supporting data
traceability.studentGoal: Gain experience with client-facing professional work
traceability.institutionalOutcome: Apply disciplinary knowledge to solve real-world problems

learningObjectives.text: Create compelling data visualizations and narrative reports that drive organizational action

traceability.employerNeed: Evidence-based recommendations our development team can implement
traceability.studentGoal: Build a portfolio of professional work
traceability.institutionalOutcome: Demonstrate professional communication skills in workplace settings

learningObjectives.text: Develop storytelling approaches that connect donor data to organizational mission and impact

traceability.studentGoal: Learn to translate complex information for different audiences
traceability.institutionalOutcome: Apply disciplinary knowledge to solve real-world problems

learningObjectives.text: Manage project timelines, deliverables, and stakeholder communications professionally

traceability.institutionalOutcome: Collaborate effectively with professionals and stakeholders

learningObjectives.text: Reflect on professional identity development and articulate career-relevant competency growth

traceability.studentGoal: Build a portfolio of professional work
traceability.institutionalOutcome: Reflect critically on personal and professional development

objectives: Understand organizational mission and donor landscape

activities.description: Meet with Development Director to understand organizational context and communication needs
Review existing donor communications, reports, and marketing materials
Reflect on organizational communication style and audience needs
Read: Strategic nonprofit communications and donor engagement
Draft project communication plan and stakeholder matrix

dealReflection.describe: Ben, what did you learn about how this organization communicates with donors? What communication materials did you review?
dealReflection.examine: How do nonprofit communications differ from corporate or media communications you've studied? What strategic principles apply across contexts?
dealReflection.articulate: Ben, what communication skills from your coursework do you expect to apply? What new approaches might you need to learn?

objectives: Understand available donor data and its limitations

activities.description: Explore donor database with focus on storytelling potential
Weekly mentor check-in: discuss data observations and communication angles
Read: Data storytelling and visualization best practices
Create initial data visualizations exploring retention patterns

deliverables: Data exploration summary with visual drafts

dealReflection.describe: Ben, what stories emerged from your initial data exploration? What visualization approaches did you try?
dealReflection.examine: How do you balance accuracy with compelling narrative when visualizing data? What ethical considerations arise in data presentation?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about finding stories in data? How does this connect to narrative techniques from your Media Writing course?

objectives: Develop key messages for each audience

activities.description: Conduct audience analysis for board, staff, and donors
Discuss audience insights with Development Director
Read: Audience segmentation in strategic communications
Draft key messages and content frameworks for each audience

dealReflection.describe: How did you approach audience analysis? What key differences did you identify between stakeholder groups?
dealReflection.examine: How do concepts from Strategic Communications apply to nonprofit contexts? What's different about communicating data versus opinions?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about tailoring messages for different audiences? How might this skill transfer to other professional contexts?

activities.description: Design and refine key data visualizations using design tools
Weekly mentor check-in: gather feedback on visual approach
Read: Visual design principles for data communication
Iterate on visualizations based on feedback

dealReflection.describe: Ben, what visualizations did you create? How did stakeholder feedback influence your design choices?
dealReflection.examine: How do you balance aesthetic appeal with data accuracy? What design principles from Visual Communication are most relevant?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about visual storytelling with data? How has this experience expanded your professional skill set?

objectives: Incorporate human elements into data story

activities.description: Conduct interviews with development staff about donor relationships
Synthesize interview themes with quantitative findings
Read: Combining qualitative and quantitative research in communications
Integrate human stories into data narrative framework

deliverables: Interview summary and narrative integration plan

dealReflection.describe: Ben, what stories did staff members share? How do these human elements complement your data analysis?
dealReflection.examine: How do you balance individual stories with aggregate data? What ethical considerations arise when sharing donor stories?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about the power of combining data with human narratives? How does this relate to storytelling principles from your coursework?

activities.description: Write and design interim findings report
Present interim findings to Development Director
Read: Effective report design and layout principles
Incorporate feedback and plan final deliverables

dealReflection.describe: How did you structure your interim report? What design choices did you make to enhance readability and impact?
dealReflection.examine: How did your presentation skills from coursework translate to this professional setting? What adjustments did you need to make?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about professional report writing and design? How has this experience built your portfolio?

objectives: Complete detailed analysis of key segments

activities.description: Finalize analysis of at-risk donor segments
Weekly mentor check-in: review recommendations approach
Read: Writing actionable recommendations for organizations
Draft recommendations with supporting rationale

deliverables: Detailed segment analysis with draft recommendations

dealReflection.describe: Ben, what recommendations did you develop? How did you ensure they were actionable and clearly communicated?
dealReflection.examine: How do you make recommendations persuasive while remaining objective? What role does evidence play in building credibility?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about translating analysis into action? How does this connect to persuasive communication principles?

activities.description: Adapt recommendations for board, staff, and donor audiences
Discuss communication approach with Development Director
Read: Change communication and stakeholder engagement
Create communication templates organization can use

dealReflection.describe: How did you adapt your recommendations for different audiences? What templates did you create?
dealReflection.examine: What makes communication sustainable beyond your project? How do you transfer your skills to the organization?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about creating lasting value through communication tools? How does this enhance your professional portfolio?

activities.description: Write and design final comprehensive report
Self-review for clarity, accuracy, and design quality
Read: Professional document design standards
Refine design elements and create appendices

dealReflection.describe: How did you approach the final report design? What professional standards did you apply?
dealReflection.examine: How do you ensure consistency across a complex document? What quality control processes did you use?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about professional document production? How does this compare to academic writing standards?

objectives: Polish all visual and written elements

activities.description: Revise final report based on mentor feedback
Review session with mentor on final report
Read: Final editing and proofreading strategies
Complete final edits and prepare for submission

dealReflection.describe: Ben, what feedback did you receive and how did you incorporate it? What final refinements did you make?
dealReflection.examine: How has your approach to revision evolved through this project? What's the value of iterative feedback?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about professional editing and quality standards? How will this influence your future work?

activities.description: Design board presentation with key insights and recommendations
Practice presentation and receive detailed feedback
Read: Executive presentation techniques and board dynamics
Refine presentation and prepare for questions

dealReflection.describe: How did you design your presentation for a board audience? What storytelling techniques did you use?
dealReflection.examine: How is presenting to a board different from academic presentations? What adjustments did you make?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about executive communication? How has this built your confidence for future professional presentations?

activities.description: Deliver final presentation to Foundation board
Debrief presentation and overall project with mentor
Read: Professional reflection and portfolio development
Complete project handoff and final reflection

dealReflection.describe: How did your final presentation go? How did the board respond to your recommendations?
dealReflection.examine: Looking back at the entire project, how did your communication skills evolve? What moments were most challenging and rewarding?
dealReflection.articulate: What are the key competencies you've developed? How will this project shape your career path in communications?

assessment.overview: Assessment emphasizes communication competencies demonstrated through professional deliverables, reflective practice showing growth, and employer evaluation of professional performance.

deliverables.name: Interim Findings Report
criteria: Clear and engaging presentation of findings

reflections.schedule: Weekly DEAL reflections submitted each Friday
criteria: Connections to communication theory and coursework
Evidence of skill development and growth

sampleWeek.subtitle: Creating compelling data visualizations
objectives: Create compelling data visualizations that communicate clearly
Develop narrative framework connecting data to organizational mission
Test and refine visual approaches based on stakeholder feedback

activities.description: Design and refine key data visualizations using Canva and other design tools
Weekly mentor check-in: gather feedback on visual approach and storytelling
Read: Visual design principles for effective data communication
Iterate on visualizations incorporating feedback and design principles

dealReflection.describe: What visualizations did you create this week? How did stakeholder feedback influence your design choices? What tools and techniques did you use?
dealReflection.examine: How do you balance aesthetic appeal with data accuracy and clarity? What design principles from Visual Communication are most applicable here?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about visual storytelling with data? How has this experience expanded your professional portfolio and skill set?

kolbPhases.experience: Creating professional communications, designing visualizations, conducting interviews, presenting to stakeholders
kolbPhases.reflection: Weekly mentor discussions, analyzing audience feedback, self-assessment of communication effectiveness
kolbPhases.conceptualization: Readings on strategic communication, data visualization, audience analysis, and professional writing
kolbPhases.experimentation: Iterating on designs, testing messages with audiences, refining presentation approaches

frameworkElements.dealReflections: Weekly reflections connecting communication practice to theory, building toward comprehensive portfolio reflection
frameworkElements.competencies: All four FieldWork competencies: Purposeful Engagement through client-facing work, Reflective Practice through DEAL model, Integrative Learning connecting to Communications coursework, Transfer Capacity through portfolio development

employerSuccessCriteria.criterion: Clear analysis of donor retention patterns with supporting data
Evidence-based recommendations the team can implement

studentLearningGoals.goal: Gain experience with client-facing professional work
Learn to translate complex information for different audiences
Build a portfolio of professional work

institutionalOutcomes.outcome: Apply disciplinary knowledge to solve real-world problems
Reflect critically on personal and professional development
Collaborate effectively with professionals and stakeholders
